post.body: She herself was heard to say that she could claim big momentum just by a sweep in Puerto Rico. She's changed her metrics from popular vote to superdelegate count to Big Mo. She's desperate.

She isn't in such a dire situation that she can't win especially since she's expected to win W.V. and Kentucky, it all comes down to how fast Obama can get more delegates despite it all. That's the real race going on at the moment.

Spoken like a true winner-take-all Republican. Sorry, kid, but Democrats don't work that way--their delegation is meted out proportionally.Ã‚Â In Indiana, she "won" 51% to 49% so she comes out at best, a single delegate more than Obama got in Indiana. She's gotta win by at least 70% in ALL the remaining states just to break even.Ã‚Â 70% ain't happening in either WV or KY.

Maybe, but I'm not Republican. I was just trying to be fair to Hillary supporters. It isn't over. It's daunting, no doubt. I support Obama and think he is the best candidate and will win against McCain, just telling it like I see it.

user.username: out of the cradle endlessly rocking

post.body: A theory that holds as much water as the theory that Obama is a Republican mole, chosen as the perfect enemy to defeat Hillary (a charming black male vs. a bulldog white woman) back in 2004. In other words, unlikely.

Thinking that Democrat primaries work like Republican primaries is being fair to Hillary supporters how, exactly?Ã‚Â The numbers aren't in her favor and that's why people are saying it's over.Ã‚Â She can go spend her war chest like a drunken sailor because it's her choice, but it's not smart.Ã‚Â And the more dumb things she does with her campaign and her money isn't going to make her look good in the next presidential election either. If she wants to remain viable for the next election, she's gotta at least maintain the appearance of being smart.Ã‚Â This ain't it.
theres no credance to obama being a republic mole though
There's no credence to your "set up" conspiracy either.

and as far as me bein a black man in america...if you havent walked in my shoes...dont worry about my paranoya factor it is just that...a theory, but a theory based on facts. that hillary could possibly market her wins in the next two states as a comeback
